channel.title: Git on Brilliun's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Git on Brilliun's Blog

item.title: Git Cleanup Local Branches Merged
item.description: TL;DR $ git branch --merged develop | egrep -v "(^\*|master|dev)" | xargs -n 1 git branch -d BTW git branch --no-merged can be used to check the branches to keep. Breakdown 1. Find branches merged # list up branches merged into 'develop' git branch --merged develop OR # list up branches merged into current branch git branch --merged 2. Exclude critical branches # Exclude branches with prefix of "*"(current), "master", or "dev" egrep -v "(^\*|master|dev)" **egrep is equivalent to grep -E
